text.headline: Marianne's mother, Mary Warner Moore, dies.
Publishes Collected Poems; awarded Pulitzer Prize and Gold Medal of the National Institute of Arts and Letters

Elected to American Academy of Arts and 
Letters
Publishes The Absentee: A Comedy in Four Acts Based on Maria Edgeworth's Novel of the Same Name
Publishes Complete Poems; receives Chevalier de l'Ordre des Arts et des Lettres, France, and the Gold Medal Award for Lifetime Achievement from the Poetry Society.
Marianne Craig Moore dies in her sleep in New York.
Timeline Sources:
text.text:
Adversity & Grace: Marianne Moore 1936-1941, edited by Heather Cass White (Victoria, B. C.: ELS Editions, 2012).

A-quiver with Significance, Marianne Moore 1932-1936, edited by Heather Cass White (Victoria, B. C.: ELS Editions, 2008).

Becoming Marianne Moore: the Early Poems, 1907-1924, edited by Robin G. Schulze (Berkeley: University of California Press, 2002).

Cristanne Miller, Cultures of Modernism: Marianne Moore, Mina Loy, Else Lasker-Schuler; Gender and Literary Community in New York and Berlin (University of Michigan Press, 2005).

Margaret Holley, The Poetry of Marianne Moore: A Study in Voice and Value (New York: Cambridge University Press, 1987).

media.caption: Photograph by Carl Van Vechten (1948)

text.headline: Marianne Moore
text.text:
A timeline of her life and works.

Publications listed by first appearance of a work only.
